what: EPA dictionary search and subset — epa_subset
title: EPA dictionary search and subset — epa_subset
text: Returns subset EPA summary individual data fulfills given parameters. Filtering can done term, data set, component (identity, behavior, modifier, setting), type data (summary individual), statistics (mean, standard deviation, covariance), institutions term belongs , gender raters.

title: EPA dictionary search and subset — epa_subset
code: epa_subset(   expr = ".*",   exactmatch = FALSE,   dataset = "everything",   component = "everything",   datatype = "summary",   group = "everything",   stat = "everything",   stat_na_exclude = TRUE,   instcodes = TRUE,   institutions = "everything",   drop.na.instcodes = FALSE )

title: EPA dictionary search and subset — epa_subset
text: expr term, regular expression, list terms regexs search. list provided, entries treated separated "", terms matching one entries returned. Default matches terms. exactmatch Logical indicating whether function return exact matches expression provided. FALSE (default), terms containing expression returned. dataset key data set (list multiple) search . Default "everything". Call dict_info() see available data sets. component component dictionary use (identity, behavior, modifier, setting). Default "everything." datatype Whether retrieve summary individual data. Default summary. group subgroup respondents use. Usually datasets subgrouped gender; options male, female, . Default "everything." Ignored datatype individual. stat statistics include subset returned. Default , options mean, sd (standard deviation), cov (covariance), n (number raters). Terms contain values required statistic excluded results. Ignored datatype individual. stat_na_exclude Ignored stat specified datatype individual. logical indicating whether exclude entries NA values required statistics. Default TRUE. instcodes Logical. Whether include institution codes output. Default TRUE. institutions Character list. Institutions include (defaults everything) drop.na.instcodes Logical. filtering institution, whether keep terms institution code.

title: Format a data frame for use in BayesACT or bayesactR — format_for_bayesact
Format a data frame for use in BayesACT or bayesactR — format_for_bayesact
text: data data frame tibble object reformat stat character desired summary statistic include. Options "mean", "sd", "cov".

title: Format a data frame for use in BayesACT or bayesactR — format_for_bayesact
text: reformatted data frame. Output data frames following columns, left right order: term column type "character" 3 columns containing given E, P, mean values (order) summary statistic type "mean": Three numeric placeholder column. used BayesACT calculations required BayesACT inputs compatibility Interact Java format. summary statistic type "sd": 3 numeric columns containing given E, P, standard deviation values. summary statistic type "cov": 9 numeric columns containing given covariance values. , order, EE, EP, EA, PE, PP, PA, AE, AP, AA. Note covariance matrix symmetric matrix duplicate columns. institution codes column. BayesACT use information, require .

title: Format a data frame for use in BayesACT or bayesactR — format_for_bayesact
text: Input data frames following requirements: must column labeled "term" coercible character. Duplicate entries allowed recommended column. must three columns titled "E", "P", "" coercible numeric. treated sentiment mean scores BayesACT. summary statistic type sd (standard deviation), must three columns titles "sd_E", "sd_P", "sd_A" coercible numeric. summary statistic type cov (covariance), must nine columns titles "cov_XX", XX two-letter permutations E, P, , coercible numeric institution codes column (titled "instcodes") provided, arbitrary one added (information required used BayesACT) columns dropped column name format requirements generally satisfied subsets epa_summary_statistics dataset created epa_subset().

title: Format a data frame for use in BayesACT or bayesactR — format_for_bayesact
